definition: wear and tear/wearing out by friction
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally

sentences.english: Based on the principle of wheel-rail interaction, the mechanism of the abrasive wear damage of wheels and rails is studied.
sentences.chinese: 運用輪軌相互作用原理，研究輪軌磨耗傷損的機理。

sentences.english: The concrete durability under the compound action of freeze-thaw and abrasion is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了凍融與磨耗複合作用下的混凝土耐久性能。

sentences.english: The grout is installed after final adjustment and installation of the roadway wearing surface.
sentences.chinese: 灌漿是在最終調整和安裝橋面磨耗層以後進行的。

sentences.english: Wear and tear of tooth of the person that weigh, produce occlusive scar, can produce periodontosis to change.
sentences.chinese: 重者牙齒磨耗，產生咬合創傷，可以產生牙周病變。

sentences.english: Remove the top half brasses of all main bearings and measure crankshaft worn down with bridge gauge.
sentences.chinese: 拆下各主軸承上瓦，用橋規測量曲軸的磨耗。

sentences.english: With less abrasion of milling media and cost.
sentences.chinese: 研磨介質磨耗小，運行成本低。

sentences.english: A optoelectronic image detecting method of wheel set flange wear is researched.
sentences.chinese: 提出用光電圖像方法非接觸檢測車輛輪對的輪緣磨耗。

definition: (of uneven surfaces) to fit together/(of gear wheels) to mesh/(dentistry) occlusion/bite
(of opposing teeth, or gears) to mesh/to engage
to fill (gap, hole, area, blank)/to pad out/to complement/(dental) filling/filled
